page.title: 13Landscape
page.content: As can be seen from the aerial photograph, the landscape could be termed as rolling. The slope mainly running from north west to south east, with the hills at Orcop and at Bryngwyn hill above Wormelow forming another ridge. Nearly all the fields are hedged, some with ditches.The Poole Spring pond being the largest area of water.The Wrigglesbrook drains the north side of the block. The area is predominately arable and pasture with some wooded areas. Roads disect the area the main ones being the A49 Hereford-Ross and A466 Hereford-Monmouth roads. There are a number of green lanes in the area but some of these are becoming overgrown due to lack of use.
